parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From prophetes; to foretell events, divine, speak under inspiration, exercise the prophetic office.
A thousand. Plural of uncertain affinity; a thousand.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.
Sack-cloth, a sign of mourning. Of Hebrew origin; 'sack'-cloth, i.e. Mohair.
